hero.subtitle: FOR SPACE RESEARCH
hero.description: Our goal is to develop and put into orbit the first satellite from M√°laga, to demonstrate the capabilities of SDR and virtualization technology in space

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: The M√°laga Space Team project at the University of M√°laga aims to develop, build and put into orbit a CubeSat oriented to communications, presenting innovative solutions on the different satellite components, to enable SDR and virtualization technology, in order to demonstrate its viability and applicability in space.

technologicalInnovation.title: Technological Innovation
technologicalInnovation.description: Developing state-of-the-art CubeSat technology, with creative, efficient and innovative solutions for the aerospace and communications sector.

educationalExcellence.title: Educational Excellence
educationalExcellence.description: Providing a unique opportunity for students to learn by practicing collaboratively with peers from multiple engineering sectors, all contributing towards the construction and subsequent launch of the first satellite from M√°laga.

collaborativeResearch.title: Collaborative Research
collaborativeResearch.description: Fostering collaboration between academic departments, industrial partners and space agencies, through networking by attending international events and participating in educational programs taught by industry leaders.

globalImpact.title: Global Impact
globalImpact.description: Contributing to the technological proof of concept, to respond to disasters and global communication challenges.

timeline.title: Project Timeline
timeline.description: Tracking progress from conception to launch of the 2U CubeSat

phase1.title: Project Initiation
phase1.description: 2U CubeSat project approved by the University Board and first financial acquisition for project development.

phase2.title: Design Phase
phase2.description: 2U CubeSat approach and design completed, having chosen the components that form the reconfigurable payload, and 3D modeling of the structure and subsystem architecture.

phase3.title: Component Acquisition
phase3.description: Acquisition of specialized components for each subsystem: sensors, processors, batteries and communication elements.
phase3.details: Processors, sensors, batteries and communication components

phase4.title: Subsystem Development
phase4.description: Design, development and individual integration of the 6 main subsystems corresponding to the satellite in the different work teams
phase4.details: Structure ‚Ä¢ Power ‚Ä¢ ADCS ‚Ä¢ CDHS ‚Ä¢ Reconfigurable Payload ‚Ä¢ Communications

phase5.title: Testing and Verification
phase5.description: Tests oriented to the correct functioning of the CubeSat in space, as well as the verification of the operation of all subsystems together, compliance with different standards and protocols.
phase5.details: Vibration test ‚Ä¢ Thermal test ‚Ä¢ Vacuum test ‚Ä¢ Subsystem compatibility test ‚Ä¶

phase6.title: Launch Preparation
phase6.description: Final verifications, integration with the launcher and activation of the reconfigurable payload for the mission.

team.title: Meet the Team
team.description: A multidisciplinary team of more than 25 students and researchers passionate about space technology and innovation.

joinTeam.title: Join the Team
joinTeam.subtitle: A Collaborative and Innovative Project
joinTeam.description: Our team brings together students and researchers from multiple disciplines: aerospace engineering, telecommunications, computer science, physics and more. We work together to develop a fully functional 2U CubeSat.
joinTeam.callToActionDescription: Join us and be part of the next generation of space innovators. We are looking for motivated students from all disciplines as well as external collaborations.

practicalExperience.title: Practical Experience
practicalExperience.description: Direct application of theoretical knowledge in a real project

interdisciplinaryCollaboration.title: Interdisciplinary Collaboration
interdisciplinaryCollaboration.description: Teamwork between different areas of knowledge

technologicalInnovation.title: Technological Innovation
technologicalInnovation.description: Development of advanced technologies for space applications

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Do you have questions about the project? Want to join the team? Contact us!

meta.description: 2U CubeSat project from the University of M√°laga. Developing cutting-edge space technology for research, education and innovation.

sponsors.title: Our Collaborators
sponsors.description: The CubeSat project is supported by leading institutions from the University of M√°laga

uma.name: University of M√°laga
uma.description: Spanish public institution founded in 1972 that offers more than 60 undergraduate degrees and more than 100 postgraduate degrees, with nearly 40,000 students and 2,450 professors distributed across 19 university centers.
uma.contribution: Institutional support, infrastructure and academic resources

mobilenet.name: Mobile & Aerospace Networks Lab
mobilenet.description: Research group specialized in next-generation networks and artificial intelligence applied to wireless networks. It has more than 30 researchers and advanced infrastructure for technological development.
mobilenet.contribution: Technical expertise, research and technological development

link.name: LINK by UMA-ATech
link.description: Real meeting space between the University of M√°laga and companies, dedicated to innovation and entrepreneurship. Facilitates university-industry collaboration.
link.contribution: Industrial connection, knowledge transfer and entrepreneurship

techTransfer.title: Technology Transfer
techTransfer.description: Bridge between university and space industry

specializedTraining.title: Specialized Training
specializedTraining.description: Development of talent in space technology
